div.p: At this time, the 100th Anniversary Celebration of the Dorothy Alexander Auditorium and the All-Class Reunion scheduled for June 12th and 13th has been postponed.Â No new date has been set yet, but rest assured that the celebration and reunion will be rescheduled.Â This project has been in the making for the past three years and we look forward to the day that we can hold these events.
Click on the following link for a message from Port Edwards Elementary School.
Below is information regardingÂ COVID-19 (coronavirus) and school planning.

a.title: Middle School Student Council âspruced upâ their hallways with motivational quotes.

h2.a: Middle School Student Council âspruced upâ their hallways with motivational quotes.

article.p: The members of the Port Edwards Public School Community believe that we offer a unique and competitive educational opportunity. Nestled along the Wisconsin River our village and surrounding townships offer a family friendly atmosphere. We serve our youth and residents through a beautiful park system, intercity bike trails, and a community YMCA.

This small suburban school district has a dedicated staff and an open flexible attitude toward instructional innovation. These qualities are key and allow us to address the academic and social needs of every student in an academy-like atmosphere.

div.div: There are currently no posted events.

div.p: It is the policy of the School District of Port Edwards that no person may be denied admission to any public school in this district or be denied participation in, be denied benefits of, or be discriminated against in any curricular, extracurricular, pupil service, recreational, or other program or activity because of the personâs sex, national origin, color, ancestry, creed, pregnancy, marital or parental status, sexual orientation, or physical, mental, emotional, or learning disability or handicap, as required by s.118.13, Wis. Stats.

This policy also prohibits discrimination as defined by Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972 (sex), Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (race and national origin), and section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973. The district encourages informal resolutions of complaints under this policy. A formal complaint resolution procedure is available, however, to address allegations of violations of the policy in the School District of Port Edwards. Any questions concerning this policy should be directed to the District Administrator of the Port Edwards Public Schools.

ul.li: John Edwards High School / Middle School
